articles.title: PBA: Meralco ousts NLEX
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines–Neck-and-neck with the enemy for most of the contest, Meralco found gaps in NLEX’s game in the final period to carve out a 100-81 and punch a ticket to the PBA Philippine Cup semifinals. Chris Banchero starred for the Bolts, who disposed of their corporate sibling in two games and arranged a best-of-seven duel against old tormentor Barangay Ginebra.

articles.title: PBA: Rain or Shine bounces back to even Series
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines–With its top gun frosty once again, Rain or Shine on Sunday turned to its youth brigade to slip past TNT, 121-113, and bring their best-of-three PBA Philippine Cup quarterfinal race to a decider. Jhonard Clarito set the tone early while Andrei Caracut put the finishing touches on the Elastopainters’ conquest of the Tropang Giga that leveled the short series to a game apiece.

articles.title: Sherwin Basindanan OT strike lift FEU to UAAP Football Finals
articles.description: SHERWIN Basindanan struck at extra time as defending champion Far Eastern University rallied past Ateneo, 2-1, to reach the UAAP Season 86 Men’s Football Final at the Rizal Memorial Stadium, Thursday night

articles.title: NBA: Mavericks hold off Thunder for 2-1 lead
articles.description: DALLAS — Luka Doncic already had a balky right knee and an achy left ankle when he fell hard on his back while battling his primary defender, Lu Dort, for a loose ball. Not only did Doncic win the ensuing jump ball, the NBA scoring champion tracked down the loose ball that followed with his Dallas Mavericks clinging to a late lead.

articles.title: AFC Filipinas U17 suffers defeat to North Korea in Women's Asia Cup
articles.description: The Filipinas’ Under-17 team suffered their first setback in the 2024 AFC U-17 Women’s Asian Cup — a 6-0 drubbing by DPR Korea on Thursday at the Bali United Training Center in Indonesia. Jon Il-Chong scored in the 17th and 27th minutes of the contest for DPR Korea, which now has the solo lead of Group A. DPR Korea has six points and a plus-13 goal difference on the back of two straight comprehensive victories.

articles.title: Stehphen Holt tells PBA crowd: You want parity? We hear you.
articles.description: Stephen Holt and Terrafirma stunning win that allowed them to force San Miguel Beer into a do-or-die match in their PBA Philippine Cup quarterfinals seemed like a message sent across the league and its fans. This is what you want; you want a competitive league, Holt addressed the crowd in a postgame interview after the Dyip’s 106-95 win Saturday at Rizal Memorial Coliseum. “You want parity, and we hear you.

articles.title: Tanhai Annis takes on new role as assistant coach for Filipinas U17
articles.description: Tahnai Annis is off to international duty once again — this time as an assistant coach for the Philippine Girls U-17 Team that will compete for a 2024 FIFA U-17 Women’s World Cup ticket in the 2024 AFC U-17 Women’s Asian Cup this May 6–19 in Bali, Indonesia.

trends.title: PBA: Terrafirma drags San Miguel by the collar into do-or-die
trends.description: Midnight refused to strike once again for Cinderella Terrafirma following a stunning win that pushed heavyweight San Miguel Beer to a fight for survival in their PBA Philippine Cup quarterfinal matchup. But for rookie Stephen Holt, the 106-95 win on Saturday afternoon at Rizal Memorial Coliseum allowed the Dyip to prove something for a long-time audience and the so-called casuals hungry to see something new to a league dominated by traditional powerhouses.

trends.title: UAAP 86 WFB: Shai Del Campo scores winner as La Salle downs UP
trends.description: With the match delicately poised at two goals each, the De La Salle Zobel alumna headed the ball home in the 90+4 minute to seal the victory for the Lady Booters. Del Campo’s winner provided the climactic finish after her teammate Maria Layacan brought La Salle back on level terms with a brace in the 25th and 31st minute.

trends.title: FEU becomes winningest UAAP Women's Football Program
trends.description: Albiño converted a free kick that broke the 1-1 stalemate to put the Lady Tamaraws ahead and eventually complete a perfect season for a record 12th title overall. Anicka Castañeda tried to restore parity late in the match, but her shot sailed past the crossbar.

trends.title: PBA: Beau Belga confident tables will turn
trends.description: Beau Belga, Rain or Shine’s foremost weapon throughout the Philippine Cup, found himself firing blanks in the Elasto Painters’ 116-99 loss to TNT in the PBA Philippine Cup quarterfinals on Friday night. The veteran big man was limited to just five points, finishing the contest at Smart Araneta Coliseum with a head-scratching 2-for-10 shooting.

trends.title: From Payatas to Morayta: Rebosura Sisters not wasting opportunity to shine on big stage
trends.description: Midnight refused to strike once again for Cinderella Terrafirma following a stunning win that pushed heavyweight San Miguel Beer to a fight for survival in their PBA Philippine Cup quarterfinal matchup. But for rookie Stephen Holt, the 106-95 win on Saturday afternoon at Rizal Memorial Coliseum allowed the Dyip to prove something for a long-time audience and the so-called casuals hungry to see something new to a league dominated by traditional powerhouses.

trends.title: NBA: Mike Budenholzer agrees to become next Suns coach
trends.description: PHOENIX — Mike Budenholzer has agreed to coach the Phoenix Suns, according to multiple reports, as the franchise turns to the man who beat them in the 2021 NBA Finals. The 54-year-old Budenholzer replaces Frank Vogel, who was fired Thursday after one season. ESPN and The Athletic both reported that Budenholzer’s deal was for five years.
